intro: Turritis drummondii var. brachycarpa, commonly known as the short-fruited turritis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in umbrella-like clusters, and the fruit is distinctive for its short, broad shape. It is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and has moderate water requirements.
